Ex-Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai Slams IndiGo Over Bengaluru Incident: ‘Left Without Air Conditioning’ - News18
summary:
Ex-Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai Slams IndiGo Over Bengaluru Incident: ‘Left Without Air Conditioning’

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: News18

Former Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai expressed his discontent with IndiGo's service after being left waiting on the tarmac in Bengaluru without air conditioning.

  • Passengers were left on the hot tarmac in Bengaluru, with the air conditioning reportedly non-operational.
  • Pai shared his experience on social media, prompting others to share similar complaints.
  • After a passenger protest, IndiGo staff used a generator to power the air conditioning.
  • Pai called on IndiGo to change their protocols to prevent future incidents.
  • IndiGo responded to his post, assuring that customer comfort is a priority and that they value feedback.
“Indigo treats its passengers badly. Sitting in 6E 7407 without AC on hot tarmac in Bengaluru. No way to treat passengers. Only after protest staff using tarmac generator for AC...” — Mohandas Pai

This incident highlights ongoing issues with passenger treatment in airlines and brings attention to the need for better customer service practices.
newTitle: Ex-Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai Criticizes IndiGo for Poor Treatment During Delay

SBI Life picks up 10% stake in Bima Sugam India Federation | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
SBI Life Acquires 10% Stake in Bima Sugam India Federation

Date: Not specified | Source: Live Mint

SBI Life has announced its decision to acquire a 10% stake in Bima Sugam India Federation for ₹6.6 crore, aiming to enhance the insurance product marketplace.

  • SBI Life's board approved an investment not exceeding 10% of Bima Sugam's paid-up equity share capital.
  • Bima Sugam India Federation is set to create a centralized marketplace for insurance products and services.
  • The company will invest ₹6.6 crore to purchase 66 lakh equity shares at a face value of ₹10 each.
newTitle: SBI Life Acquires 10% Stake in Bima Sugam India Federation

title: JSW Energy Jumps 8% Amid O2 Power Acquisition; Motilal Oswal Shares Target Price - News18
summary:
JSW Energy Shares Rise 8% Following O2 Power Acquisition Announcement

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: News18

JSW Energy's stock surged by 8% after the announcement of its acquisition of O2 Power, a renewable energy platform, reflecting strong investor confidence.

  • JSW Energy’s subsidiary, JSW Neo Energy, will acquire O2 Power, valued at Rs 12,468 crore ($1.47 billion).
  • The deal includes acquiring O2 Power Midco Holdings and O2 Energy SG, pending regulatory approval.
  • Post-announcement, shares of JSW Energy reached Rs 673.05, marking a 7.67% increase.
  • Motilal Oswal has set a target price of Rs 810 per share for JSW Energy.
  • The stock has seen a 67% increase from its 52-week low, although it's down 17% from its high.
“Motilal Oswal Financial Services has a favorable outlook on JSW Energy, indicating strong operational performance.”

The increase in JSW Energy's shares indicates positive market sentiment regarding its expansion into renewable energy, showcasing the potential for future growth.
newTitle: JSW Energy Shares Rise 8% Following O2 Power Acquisition Announcement

title: 'Rupee 58.58 against Dollar in 2014, it's 85.27 now': Congress recalls PM Modi's 2013 remarks on deprecia - The Times of India
summary:
'Rupee 58.58 against Dollar in 2014, it's 85.27 now': Congress recalls PM Modi's 2013 remarks on depreciating currency during UPA government

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Congress has referenced past remarks made by Prime Minister Modi regarding the depreciation of the Indian Rupee, contrasting them with the current exchange rate of 85.27 against the dollar.

  • The Rupee was valued at 58.58 against the dollar in 2014.
  • Current statistics show a significant depreciation with the Rupee now at 85.27.
  • Congress has criticized the government's handling of the economy.
“In 2013, Modi warned against the falling currency, but now his government is facing the same issue.”

The ongoing depreciation of the Rupee raises concerns regarding the economic policies of the current administration and its implications for ordinary citizens.
newTitle: Congress Criticizes PM Modi on Currency Depreciation

title: ITC Hotels Listing Date: 'Within 60 days from...' - Big update from ITC ahead of demerger record date - ET Now
summary:
ITC Hotels Listing Date Update

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: ET Now

ITC Limited has officially announced the listing date for ITC Hotels shares, in light of its upcoming demerger. The shares are expected to debut on the NSE and BSE by February 16, 2025.

  • ITC has confirmed an update on the listing date of ITC Hotels shares.
  • As part of the demerger scheme, shareholders will receive 1 share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares of ITC held.
  • 20% of ITC Hotels' inventory is under 5 years old, operating at 75% occupancy levels.
“ITC and ITC Hotels mutually acknowledged that all conditions specified in Clause 28 of the Scheme have been satisfied.”

To qualify for the new shares, ITC shareholders must be on record as of January 6, 2025.
newTitle: ITC Hotels Listing Date Update Ahead of Demerger
